abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Primary Teacher
            Development Project for Vietnam were as follows: outcomes
            were highly satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was low or negligible, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) a standards-based approach in education
            has much to recommend it in terms of clear expectations for
            outcomes, objective evidence of achievement, planning for
            growth or development, and rewarding progress; 2) changes in
            teaching methods are best achieved through combining theory
            and practice, as happened when teachers undertook training
            modules while involved in teaching the new curriculum; 3)
            teachers appreciated the Professional Profile because it
            defined their work, set targets for improvement, and offered
            rewards for better performance; and 4) the motivation for
            teachers to engage in self improvement could be impeded
            unless performance appraisal is included in the criteria for
            teachers' titles, along with qualifications.

5085371.trustfund:
TF036673-SOUTH EAST ASIA REGION -
            EDUCATION PROJECTS (VIETNAM AND CAMBODIA),TF023861-PRIMARY TEACHERS COFINANCING
            GRANT FROM DFID (UK),TF025123-PHRD-PRIMARY TEACHER TRAINING,TF030793-LUXEMBOURG CTF - FY06,TF023244-DFID GRANT FOR PRIMARY
            EDUCATION IN VIETNAM,TF035641-EAST ASIA, VIETNAM, CAMBODIA -
            EDUCATION PROJECTS

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Primary Teacher
            Development Project for Vietnam is to lay the foundation for
            a nationwide program to upgrade the quality of the primary
            teaching service. The project has four main components. The
            first develops teacher professional standards (profile) by
            supporting a Profile Coordination Team, applies the profile
            to training courses and to teacher assessment, and finances
            action research to refine the profile. The second component
            funds a training program for teachers and education
            managers. It specifically finances a needs assessment and
            specification of the contents of the training packages and
            preparation of trial training packages, improves the
            capacity of teacher training institutes, supports the
            appraisal of training packages, and publishes and delivers
            training modules. The third component provides suppots for a
            Quality Assurance Team, improves the personnel management
            information system, develops accreditation and teacher
            classification procedures, and provides communications and
            training for school improvement. The fourth component
            supports revision in the Terms of Service for teachers. It
            supports technical assistance and research, preparation and
            discussion of options and supporting changes, and consensus
            building activities.
